titles.title: New Automobile Add-On Disclosure and Consumer Protection Act
To protect automobile consumers by requiring complete disclosure and warranty of any add-ons included with the sale of new automobiles.

bill.summary: 3/13/2003--Introduced. New Automobile Add-On Disclosure and Consumer Protection Act - Requires each dealer to disclose to each consumer that purchases a new automobile: (1) a dealer add-on invoice; and (2) a dealer add-on warranty statement. Specifies the timing of such disclosures. States that dealer violation of this Act results in liability to the United States for a civil penalty of not more than $10,000 or the total cost of the new automobile involved (including add-ons, taxes, and any other fees charged to the customer by the dealer), whichever is greater. Permits a private right of action by a consumer aggrieved by a violation of this Act.
